body.name: ULTIMEA 4K Projector with HDR10, 700 ANSI Lumens WiFi 6 Bluetooth Projector, Native 1080P, Versatile OS, Object Avoidance, Screen Adaption and Focus, 6D Keystone Smart Projector for iOS, Android
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 7 hrs 32 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 14. Order within 17 hrs 2 mins
features: 4K Decoding HDR10 & Stunning Brightness Uniformity: The Apollo P40 projector utilizes premium LCD panels and optimized optical design to deliver 80% brightness uniformity that maintains stunning images and accurate color throughout the lifespan. 4K decoding and HDR10 enhance more detailed shadows even in the dark. Bright scenes appear crisp and clear, while dark scenes remain detailed with deep blacks. Blurred edges never bother you, the details in each corner are optimized.

2024 Upgraded USPAA Technology: The Apollo P40 projector applies self-developed ULTIMEA USPAA algorithm for enhanced clarity and optimized 6D auto keystone correction (±50° horizontal/vertical/rotating). Equipped with intelligent obstacle avoidance and automatic screen alignment, it effortlessly blends into any environment. Only takes 2 steps to achieve these intelligence functions (Turn on the corresponding setting and click autofocus button on the remote control.)

700 ANSI Lumens & ULTIMEA OS: The upgraded LTPS LCD technology improves light transmittance by 15%, and the advanced LED light sources boast up to 700 ANSI lumens with low heat, concentrating energy to achieve a leap in brightness. Adapting to ambient light, even the vast starry sky and backlit scenery can be clearly rendered without drawing the curtains during the day, all on the 150" screen. With the brand new ULTIMEA OS, you won't have to spend extra time researching operations.

5.8GHz + 2.4GHz Dual WiFi & Bidirectional Bluetooth: The Ultimea projector features an enhanced wifi antenna and chipset for stable connection and low input latency. Built-in bidirectional Bluetooth 5.1 for easy syncing to ULTIMEA soundbars or Bluetooth speakers. Additionally, the Bluetooth projector can turn into an ingenious private Bluetooth speaker. 10W large audio cavity speakers with built-in DSP chip to reproduce clear treble and deep bass.

Dustproof Design & Versatile Connections: The fully enclosed optical engine design effectively prevents dust from entering, ensures low light wane, and extends lifespan. You would never get into trouble with the issue of blurred or yellowish pictures after long-time use. Its gunmetal grey design luxuriously and seamlessly blends into your home's décor. Equipped with HDMI, USB, AV, and audio ports, it's easily compatible with smartphones, TV Sticks, Roku, Switch, laptops, and more.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Analysing Feedback from thousands of P40 users, the 2024 update of the Apollo P40 Projector integrates three key benefits that significantly improve the user's home cinema experience.
Previous page Next page 1 4K&HDR10 2 Cinematic & Full HD 3 Bright Ambient Light 4 Brilliant on Four Corners

Intelligent Obstacle Avoidance Apollo P40 utilizes the latest chipset and CMOS camera for precise obstacle recognition in seconds, allowing you to easily set up and enjoy cinema-like moments without manual adjustment. Get Clear Image in 3 Seconds The Smart Auto Focus Projector features auto focus function and adjusts picture sharpness automatically in 3 seconds. It allows you to immerse yourself in a world of clear movies without dialing annoying focus rings. Automatic Square Anywhere The Apollo P40 native full hd 1080p projector intelligently recognizes its positioning and automatically gets a square image in 5 seconds. Intelligent Screen Alignment Apollo P40 automatically aligns the image with the projector screen in seconds, allowing you to set up your private cinema in every corner of your home. Lightning-Fast Bluetooth The built-in Bluetooth 5.1 enables easy synchronization with ULTIMEA soundbars, Bluetooth speakers or smartphones. The Beamer Wifi can also be used as a private speaker. Screen Mirror Connectivity Cast content from your iOS or Android phone with ease.Make sure the projector and phone must be connected to the same Wi-Fi. 1. Open the projector's "Wi-Fi settings", select the corresponding network, enter the password and connect; 2. Go back to "Home", click "Airplay/Mirocast", and wait for the signal to connect; 3. Open "Screen Mirroring" on your phone, select "U0320-XXXX" and click connect.
Previous page Next page 1 WIFI-6 2.4G&5G 2 Surging Surround Sound 3 Low Noise 4 Sensitive Remote Control 5 Plug And Play
Previous page Next page 1 Upgraded Intuitive OS 2 Long Service Life 3 Low Light Wane

Previous page Outdoor Party Night When the Sunsets, a Movie Begins on Patio, Garden, or Backyard Bigger screen size from a short distance. Free space and free distance. Ultimea P40 = Smart TV (TV Stick is not included)+ Smart Wallpaper + Bigger Screen Size Direct access to USB File. Perfect for small meeting or business presentation. Not only be used for a cozy movie night but transform your home as a "smart wall". Next page 1 Outdoor Party Night 2 Short Distance 3 Giant-Screen Gaming 4 Office Presentation 5 Window On The World

Will black spots appear on the projector screen? The Apollo P40 has fully sealed optics that prevent dust from entering, so the black spots will not appear on the screen. How to get a better autofocus effect? Use autofocus function within 9.84ft and front projection. If exceeded, use the electronic focus on the remote control to focus. Does it support mirror Netflix content from smartphones? Due to HDCP copyright, the projector doesn't support cast Netflix content from smartphones directly. Please use a TV stick, Chromecast, and Roku to enjoy Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon Prime video. Why is there no sound after connecting the TV stick? Please disable the Dolby and DTS sound on the TV Stick "audio setting" menu. What is the difference between HDR10 4K projector and 4K projector? The function of HDR10 is to enhance brightness, clarity, resolution, color contrast, etc., which is several times clearer than ordinary 4K projectors without HDR10.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I honestly think that you wouldn't be able to beat this projector for the price:
reviews.reviewText: This is honestly such a great projector for the price. I wanted an inexpensive projector to use with my blow-up outdoor movie screen, and to use in my cigar room when the weather outside isn't as good. With the Anker battery pack, blow-up screen, and portable speakers I can literally set this up anywhere in 5 minutes and have an outdoor theater. I'd also like to give a shout-out to their customer service, who was incredibly responsive and helpful. The cooling fan inside got a bit off-balance and would often make a loud noise, and they immediately sent me another one, then just had me ship the original one back in the box (I didn't have to ship mine in first and be without it). They followed up, they made sure I was happy, I'm very happy with them. Now, for the pros and cons:Pros:This is lightweight, but still solidly built. It doesn't feel cheap. The auto-focus and auto-keystone both work really well (although the lights really need to be off before you turn it on or it won't work as well). If you need to, though, you can easily and accurately focus it with the remote. It can rear-project (which I do with the outdoor blow-up screen), front-project, and project upside-down (to mount on the ceiling). It is partially a "smart" device, although they don't pay the licensing fees to the major networks so you'll still need something like a Fire Stick. The picture quality is very good, especially for this price. It has a USB port on it in order to power a device (like my Fire Stick).Cons:Honestly, at this price point anything I mention here is nitpicking a bit . . . but still things you would want to know before you buy. While you *can* connect it to Bluetooth speakers, if you are using it with a Fire Stick or something else plugged into HDMI, the lag is pretty annoying. This isn't really the fault of the projector, but something to plan for. I just connected my Fire Stick to the Bluetooth speakers directly, which works well. The interface on it is a little kludgy, but I only use it to reverse the image or select the input so it works fine for me.I honestly can't find anything else to fault it with. Could it be brighter? Sure, but not at this price point. In my patio with a streetlight nearby, rear projecting a 16ft image is a little on the dark side but a 10ft image in a dark room is perfect. I'm reasonably sure that a 16ft front-projected image in a dark room would be great.If I was the engineer I'd add 2 things. I would make the screw that comes out of the bottom to tilt it be designed to be a lot longer (or telescopic), the keystone limit is way above the limit of the screw. Not a big deal at all, I just put a small block under it. The second would be a video delay so that you could match the sound after going through both HDMI and Bluetooth. But neither of those things are necessary, just thoughts for future versions.To wrap up this book I've now written, if you want a basic projector for a great price with a decent warranty and great quality . . . I'd buy this one hands-down. If you have the money for a brighter 4K fully-smart device, then you aren't looking at this one. Since I move this a lot and even travel with it, I didn't want to spend a fortune on it and I couldn't be happier with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Honestly a great little 1080p budget projector!
reviews.reviewText: My initial order arrived with issues so I had to do a return/replace*. Upon inspection of the first device, the lense was smudged and there was a weird auditory popping noise that would come from the projector every 5 minutes or so.After returning the first device, it's been smooth sailing since receiving my replacement. The projector works really great in a small dimly lit living room. I saw some people say you need absolute darkness, but honestly it's not that bad even during the day time.My favorite feature of this projector would have to be the auto focus and manual focus functions. I haven't had any issues at all getting the projection to focus and look sharp on my screen. Overall I think they really nailed the auto-sizing and focus settings.In summary, if you are looking for a 1080p budget projector that is capable of scaling to 4k, look no further. For reference, I also own a very high end Sony 4k projector. The obvious differences are the HDR depth, brightness, clarity, and pixels. But for the price point you are paying for the Ultimea, I think this is a great deal overall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Everything works well! Picture quality is awesome but there is a loud humming/buzzing noise while it’s on. You drown it out after a while but definitely have another source for sound.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great projector and customer service!
reviews.reviewText: Update 12.16.23 : So after seeing my original review below the seller reached out to me to address my concerns with the zoom functions that are only accessible after disabling multidirectional auto correction and getting the projector firmware updated to properly support HDR10. Long story short, this projector is now working like a charm after the update and I have now given this a 5 star review as the seller took the initiative to address my concerns after the initial setup. Thank you for the quick response and making this right! I will leave the original review below in case any of you run into the same issues that I did.Original 3 star Review:This is being advertised as HDR10 and 4k but it does not support HDR10. It does display 4k with no issue but not actually supporting HDR10 as advised is false advertising. It also lacks the basic zoom function that normally comes with most projectors. The image quality is ok but can stand to be a tad bit brighter for rooms that are not dark. It works great for darker rooms but it starts to wash out in brighter rooms. Will only be able to give it 3 stars as a result of not being HDR10 supporting as advised and missing the zoom option that is standard for any projector.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Clear and bright
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. If you are looking to buy a projector and not sure what to get, you won’t go wrong with this projector. There are two things I care the most which are clarity and brightness. This one have both; Im impressed with the brightness of this projector which is 700 ansi lumens. With this affordable price, the projector outperforms!!! I have returned several projectors but I decided to keep this one because I just love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For a projector that I got on sale for $220 with a claimed LED lamp life of 50,000 hours (4 hours a day for 34 years) this goes way way beyond expectations. I bought a $50 screen because I was looking for a cheap way to watch movies in bed, but I’m actually sending it back because it has a gray tint for poor projection conditions and the contrast is so nice (at this price point) on this thing that it looks better on my light yellow wall than it does on the gray screen. It deserves a much better white screen so now I have to go figure out which one of those to get.The fan is very quiet (totally inaudible with a movie even at medium volume) and the built in speaker is very surprisingly good! I haven’t even made the effort to connect it to my real speakers because the sound is perfect for casual bedroom watching.I wouldn’t hesitate for a moment to buy this again or recommend it to anyone looking for a cheap solution. It’s perfect!

reviews.reviewTitle: Great quality and an even better price.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This is my first projector and I am extremely happy with it. The image quality is great, and so is the audio.It’s easy to set up. Just place, plug in, connect hdmi device and play. My Xbox One games work fine but there’s a delay and bit of a lag with my Xbox series X games so I don’t recommend it for next generation consoles. Nintendo switch games work fine as well.Auto focus and auto keystone correction work great and make life easier. Little needs to be done with placing or correcting the image once projected. The option to manually zoom and adjust brightness, contrast, sharpness, etc. is also available.I’m casting the image at about 120 inches on a teal coloured wall about 13 feet away and I am pleased with the image colour and quality. Naturally it looks better/more enhanced in a dark room but it’s still watchable in a lit up room. I can only imagine how much brighter and more defined the image would be with a quality projector screen or at least some HD projector wall paint.Audio from the projector speakers are impressive and will suffice if you don’t have an audio system or external speakers, but I always recommend a set of decent speakers to add to the experience.I didn’t notice much (if any) difference in picture quality while streaming netflix in 1080P on my Xbox One compared to streaming in 2160 on my Xbox series X. I even played a 4K disc and there was still no noticeable difference between that and the 1080P display.In the end, I’m giving this product 5 stars for exceeding my expectation and for being listed at such a great price. If you’re looking for your first good quality budget projector, for casual or home theatre use, this product will not disappoint.

Ho recentemente acquistato il proiettore ULTIMEA 4K su Amazon e sono completamente soddisfatto dell'acquisto. La qualità dell'immagine è straordinaria, con dettagli nitidi e colori vibranti. La facilità di installazione è stata sorprendente, e il design compatto del proiettore lo rende facile da posizionare. Le funzionalità avanzate, come la correzione keystone automatica, migliorano ulteriormente l'esperienza visiva. Con un prezzo accessibile e prestazioni di alto livello, consiglio vivamente il proiettore ULTIMEA 4K a tutti gli appassionati di home entertainment.

reviews.reviewTitle: Perfecto por el precio. Buena luminosidad, buen enfoque.
reviews.reviewText: Español:Reseña actualizada:He sido contactado por el servicio al cliente y me han ofrecido reemplazar el proyector con una versión más reciente. Lo recibí de Amazon Alemania, y aunque la forma exterior es básicamente la misma, la calidad de la imagen es mucho mejor, casi perfecta. Por esta razón, voy a aumentar las estrellas de 2 a 5.En la foto, el proyector superior es el nuevo con software v3, el inferior es el antiguo con software v2.El contraste y la nitidez son un 80% mejores, la luminosidad probablemente sea la misma.¡El servicio al cliente es el mejor que he tenido para un artículo tecnológico de marca asiática!Reseña antigua:Tenía grandes expectativas con este proyector después de haber visto y leído muchas críticas positivas.Bueno: La luminosidad es buena incluso con algunas luces encendidas, en la oscuridad es muy buena.Malo: El enfoque no funciona perfectamente, parece que el enfoque solo está bien en el centro de la imagen, borroso en los bordes, no uniforme. El enfoque automático o manual no solucionan el problema.No estoy seguro si es una unidad defectuosa o un problema general. El mío es v U0320 v2.14, tal vez sea una versión antigua.English;Updated review:I have been contacted by the customer service and I have been offered to have the projector replaced with a newer version. I received it from Amazon Germany, and even if the outside shape is basically the same the quality of the image is way better, almost perfect, for this reason I am going to increase the stars from 2 to 5.In the photo, the top projector is the new one with v3 software, the lower one is the old one with v2 software.Contrast and sharpness is 80% better, brightness probably the same.Best customer service ever for an Asian branded technological item!Old review:I had high expectations on this projector after having watched and read many positive reviews.Good: Brightness is good even with some lights on, in the dark is very good.Bad: The focus doesn't work perfectly, it seems the focus is ok only in the center of the image, blurred in the edge, not uniform, autofocus or manual focus don't fix the problem.Not sure if it is a bad unit or general problem. Mine is v U0320 v2.14, maybe it is an old version

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I bought this projector as used/refurbished for £200. So it's hard to compare as it's far better than other £200 projectors and I haven't tried others at the standard price. I'm not using a screen, just projected straight onto an off white/cream wall.The picture quality is very good, sharp, with good colour contrast. At times, when the video is very bright it reflects off the wall and causes the room to brighten, making the image wash out as if there's a light on. But this is down to how I have it set up, so I'm not taking any points away, just an FYI if you plan on using this without a screen/bright coloured room.The unit itself is very quiet. I'm sat less than a meter away and it's no louder than the PC it sits on.The inbuilt speakers are surprisingly good, you can easily watch a film right next to it with no issues. Obviously, not a lot of bass but very surprised.Set up is as easy as plugging it it and finding the right spot for it to sit, there doesn't seem to be a manual zoom, so the screen is dependant on how far away the projector is from the wall. In my pictures, the unit is maybe 5 metres away from the wall and 1.5m off the ground.Overall I'm very happy with the projector, even if I paid full price I think I would still be very happy.All I've used so far is the HDMI connection, I'm probably not going to bother with BT as its set up next to my PC.If you turn off the automatic adjustment in thr menu you can then use 4 point keystone manually. If you're not straight on to the way then the edges get blury a bit, only a problem when it comes to text on screen.Would be nice if there were some apps, it only has manual inputs. This isn't a negative point as its a projector and it still projects. But would of been a nice addition.

Que dire de plus que les autres commentaires ? A peine il est arrivé à la maison qu'on l'a monté et c'est tout à fait ce qu'on cherchais, surtout à ce prix la, on ne voulais pas taper dans les grosses marque, certes on passe à côté de la 4k et du laser, mais franchement de loin, je vois pas trop la différence (Y'en a une c'est certain mais j'ai pas assez l'œil pour la voir) Donc ici du 1080p natif, avant on avais de la 720p, la différence se voit tout de suite, c'est tellement nette, les couleurs sont très bonnes aussi, loin d'un écran oled par exemple, facile c'est sur mais bref. La luminosité est époustouflante pour ce prix la je dois dire, on l'a testé de plain jour juste volet semi fermé et on vois ultra bien, bon oui c'est mile fois mieux dans le noir complet. Le faite qu'il soit connecté en wifi et ou en Bluetooth change tout, vous avez accès a votre smartphone aux mise à jours s'il y'a etc... Bref il est connecté, mais pas android tv ou équivalant par contre, il vous faudra un stick pour ajouter la fonction, nous ça nous dérange pas, puisqu'il est branché sur le pc en hdmi donc il lit tout. Les haut parleurs sont bons mais on sait très bien que personnes ne s'en sert, et enfin il est très silencieux, on l'oublie vite, enfin sa meilleurs fonction ou la j'ai dit "Chapeau !" C'est toute les corrections trapézoïdale, auto focus, horizontal et vertical automatiques, c'est génial, vous le poser, il bosse tout seul c'est super et pour le coup, c'est un sans faute cette partie la, ultra rapide et très nette. Bref on recommande à 100% surtout quand y'a une promo.
